progetto

Interface IClientController

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IGameController
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClientController, ClientControllerStub

    public interface IClientController
extends IGameController
    This is the main controller that contains all the references to every connection, every proxy model and every view. This class hides the multiplicity of connections, so that every view can be attached to the same containers without being aware of any change.

    • Method Detail

      • setCurrentClientGame

        void setCurrentClientGame(int index)
        set the current game. The current game is the one that will be observed
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the game that must be set

      • getMessageCallback

        Callback<java.lang.String> getMessageCallback()
        Returns:
        the callback that is called every time a message is received by the current connection

      • getRoomViewCallback

        Callback<RoomView> getRoomViewCallback()
        Returns:
        the callback that is called every time the roomview of the current connection is changed

      • getServerViewCallback

        Callback<ServerStateView> getServerViewCallback()
        Returns:
        the callback that is called every time the server state of the current connection is changed

      • getModel

        IModel getModel()
        Specified by:
        getModel in interface IGameController
        Returns:
        the the immutable model that was last received from the server

      • getObservable

        ObservableModel getObservable()
        Specified by:
        getObservable in interface IGameController
        Returns:
        the model that is persistent but not thread safe. You can observer the various part of this if you wish to be notified every time they change. It does ensure that this model contains only between-actions data.

      • createConnection

        boolean createConnection(java.lang.String ip,
                         boolean rmi)
        creates a new connection
        Parameters:
        ip - the adress of the server
        rmi - true if you wish to create a rmi connection
        Returns:
        true if the connection was build correctly. False otherwise. Ensure that will not return until the connection is created
